lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/Donald.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Donald.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
Donald is a task manager. He allows you to create and maintain a list of tasks. Happy tasking!
1. Ensure that you have Java 11 or above installed.
1. Follow the instructions on downloading the latest version of `Donald` from [here](http://link.to/duke).
Add three types of tasks: Todo tasks, Deadline tasks and Event tasks. Todo tasks don't require time but events and deadlines do.
List all of the tasks added.
Finds a task by a particular given keyword.
:bulb: `NAME is the name of the task we wish to add`
Adds a new item to the list of todo items.
Create a todo to sleep: `todo sleep`
Adds a new item to the list of deadline items.
Create a deadline to submit CS assignment by 3rd October, 2020, 23:59: `deadline CS assignment /by 03/10/2020 23:59`
Adds a new item to the list of event items.
Create an event to attend Christmas mass at 25th December, 2020, 23:00: `event Xmas mass /at 25/12/2020 23:00`
Marks a task at a particular index as done
Mark the task number 2 as done: `done 2`
Lists all of the tasks currently in the list
Deletes a task at a particular index
Finds a task given a particular keyword
Find a task using the keyword 'sleep': `find sleep`
deadline | deadline DEADLINE_NAME /by dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm | deadline CS assignment /by 03/10/2020 23:59
event | event EVENT_NAME /at dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm | event Xmas mass /at 25/12/2020 23:00

"the tasks better than I do. Some people say that I'm even better than Duke!";
public static final String WHAT_MESSAGE = "So, what can I do for you?";
public static final String NOT_FOUND_MESSAGE = "There are no such items according to the keyword you've given. Sorry!";
public static final String FOUND_MESSAGE = "I've found these many tasks: ";
public static final String MATCHING_MESSAGE = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";
public static final String COMMAND_NOT_FOUND_MESSAGE = "Sorry! I can't find your command. Please retype your command.";

public static final String TASK_ADDED_MESSAGE ="Got it. I've added this task:";
public static final String TASK_REMOVED_MESSAGE ="Noted. I've removed this task:";
public static final String TASK_DONE_MESSAGE = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:";
public static final String TASKS_IN_LIST_MESSAGE = "Here are the tasks in your list: ";
public static final String NO_TASKS_IN_LIST = "There are no tasks left for you. Add a new task!";
public static final String SAVE_FILE_ERROR = "There was an error in loading the save file!";
public static final String TASK_NUMBER_ERROR = "The task number entered does not exist. Re-enter the task number";
public static final String DATE_FORMAT_ERROR = "The date has either not been entered or is in the wrong format. \n" +
"Enter the date in the format dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm";
